pr_title: [icloud] Fix JSON parsing and minor bugfixes

timeline.body:
```suggestion
                updateStatus(ThingStatus.OFFLINE, ThingStatusDetail.COMMUNICATION_ERROR, "iCloud response invalid: " + e.getMessage());
```

And remove the logger. Thing status changes are logged anyway
timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
updateStatus(ThingStatus.OFFLINE, ThingStatusDetail.COMMUNICATION_ERROR, "Response = " + json);
updateStatus(ThingStatus.OFFLINE, ThingStatusDetail.COMMUNICATION_ERROR, "iCloud response invalid: " + e.getMessage());

And remove the logger. Thing status changes are logged anyway
timeline.author: J-N-K

timeline.message:
Fix iCloud JSON parsing

Signed-off-by: Kristof Rado <rado.krisi@gmail.com>

Added NonNullByDefault annotations

Signed-off-by: Kristof Rado <rado.krisi@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyHTML:
If there is a default, add it here (BTW: is it really needed that this is Integer instead of int?)

public Integer refreshTimeInMinutes = 5;

else annotate the with @Nullable:

public @Nullable String appleId;
timeline.author: J-N-K

replies.bodyText: I think it can be int. I will try to change it and see if the build will succeed.
replies.author: radokristof

timeline.body: I think adding `@NonNullByDefault` to DTO classes is not necessary and avoids your problems.
timeline.bodyText: I think adding @NonNullByDefault to DTO classes is not necessary and avoids your problems.
timeline.bodyHTML: I think adding @NonNullByDefault to DTO classes is not necessary and avoids your problems.
timeline.author: J-N-K

replies.bodyText: Ok I will remove these. I just added from the Travis warnings, didn't checked that it might be needed or not :)

timeline.body: It doesn't make sense to provide any of these as `null`, right? You should make a null-check before instantiating `ICloudConnection` (found it in `startHandler`, if any of the required credentials is null, set the thing to `OFFLINE/CONFIGURATION_ERROR` with a message stating what is wrong)
timeline.bodyText: It doesn't make sense to provide any of these as null, right? You should make a null-check before instantiating ICloudConnection (found it in startHandler, if any of the required credentials is null, set the thing to OFFLINE/CONFIGURATION_ERROR with a message stating what is wrong)
timeline.bodyHTML: It doesn't make sense to provide any of these as null, right? You should make a null-check before instantiating ICloudConnection (found it in startHandler, if any of the required credentials is null, set the thing to OFFLINE/CONFIGURATION_ERROR with a message stating what is wrong)
timeline.author: J-N-K

replies.bodyText:
Yes this makes sense. However if I add a null check for these parameters where this function is called, then this Nullable annotation can be removed right?
Will the tests succeeds even if there is a NonNullByDefault annotation? So these tests are non-static tests right?
replies.author: radokristof

replies.bodyText: Exactly, the @Nullable should be removed then. If the tests fail then, there is a bug.
replies.author: J-N-K
